item.title: Wearing something to click an object?
item.dc:creator: @Proview Proview
item.description:
@Proview wrote:

So what i want is so that people can shoot the target, if they’re wearing a crystal bow. so heres my case:

case 2513:
if (actionTimer == 0) {
if (wear(4212, 3)) {
startAnimation(426);
sendMessage("You shoot the target!");
addSkillXP(41, 4);
actionTimer = 65;

} else if (playerHasItem(4212)) {
sendMessage("You need to wear that crystal bow you have!");
actionTimer = 20;

} else {
sendMessage("You need a crystal bow to train here, wear this!");
addItem(4212, 1);
actionTimer = 20;
}
}

break;

So when i have a bow in invent it tells me to wear it (that works,
So when i dont have a bow it tells me to wear one, and gives me one (that works)
When i equipping a bow it shoots the target (this part don’t work, it just gives me a bow in invent)

So i gota fix the :

if (wear(4212, 3)) {

I guess…
So what would i put instead of that which would be if the player is equipping a bow (4212).

I appreciate all help

– Thanks –

Read full topic
item.source: Wearing something to click an object?
